content.prompt: Which of the following best paraphrases lines 26-27 ("Who can get thee,/He shall be noble, valiant, honest, wise")?

choices.label: It is better to be noble, valiant, honest, and wise than to have riches.
A rich person will be esteemed noble, valiant, honest, and wise.
A virtuous person is likely to become wealthy as well
Getting riches may cause a person to disregard nobility, valor, honesty, and wisdom.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Identify and describe details, diction, or syntax in a text that reveal a narrator's or speaker's perspective.
